benchmark_details.name: DeHate (A Stable Diffusion-based Multimodal Approach to Mitigate Hate Speech in Images)
benchmark_details.overview: The paper introduces a multimodal dataset for identifying hate in digital content, leveraging stable diffusion techniques to generate hate attention maps and blurring hateful regions from images.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To create a dataset focused on dehating digital content and encourage research in hate speech mitigation.

data.source: Hatenorm dataset and generated through the stable-diffusion model.
data.annotation: Using Diffusion Attentive Attribution Maps (DAAM) for generating heatmaps to identify hateful content.

methodology.calculation: IoU was computed between the predicted blurred component and the ground truth blurred component in the test dataset.
methodology.interpretation: A higher IoU indicates better performance of the dehate model.
methodology.baseline_results: Baseline performance is an IoU score of 0.49.

targeted_risks.harm: Mitigation of harmful and hateful content in digital images.
